item.title: Summary and video from "Distributed Transactions at Scale in Amazon DynamoDB", a retro-yet-modern protocol with cute little optimizations: <https://emptysqua.re/blog/review-distributed-transactions-at-scale-dynamodb/>
item.description:
A. Jesse Jiryu Davis

Summary and video from "Distributed Transactions at Scale in Amazon DynamoDB", a retro-yet-modern protocol with cute little optimizations: <https://emptysqua.re/blog/review-distributed-transactions-at-scale-dynamodb/>

Ivan Prisyazhnyy

> This is _optimistic_ concurrency control: the write transaction doesnâ€™t lock any items, to avoid blocking non-transactional operations.
interesting fact that Weikum separates the concepts of the Optimistic/Pessimistic schedulers and Optimistic/Pessemistic protocols. So that the protocol can be Optimistic in Pessimistic schedulers class.

Pessimistic schedulers are those who in the worst case would turn into a serial schedulers when everyone are blocked but one transaction. TO is optimistic in the sense that it is not expecting a Bad thing would happen so it (a) does not lock, and (b) allows all ops to pass by default until the conflict is met. The thing is that all the rest optimizations of the TO protocols are tend to Postpone transactions to reduce the Aborts which is exactly the Pessimistic behavior.

Finally, TO stands in the Pessimistic class in the book.

Ivan Prisyazhnyy

(see TO)

A. Jesse Jiryu Davis

That's interesting! I was uncertain when I wrote "this is optimistic" in my summary, but the paper called their algorithm optimistic so I decided it was ok.

Saurav Prakash

Wondering how does it work with single item level operation(e.g UpdateItem) which is also part of some tx and say have gone through first phase of the 2PC.
Does it simply reject such single item ops in such a case with a suitable error message?

Ivan Prisyazhnyy

> Does it simply reject such single item ops in such a case with a suitable error message?
in what case?

the invariant of the Phase of the TO protocol in which 2PC precommit is accepted is that the Tx must be accepted whatever it takes in the future
